segments.title: Defining Density Concept
segments.summary: Explains density as the ratio of mass to volume, measured in kg/m³. Uses examples like water having density of 1000 kg/m³ or 1 g/cm³ to illustrate the concept.

segments.title: Air Density Variation
segments.summary: Discusses how air density varies with altitude, from 0.1 g/cm³ at surface to 0.004 g/cm³ at 10km height. Explains this variation is due to the weight of atmosphere pressing down.

segments.title: Density and Floating
segments.summary: Explains how objects with lower density float while higher density objects sink. Uses examples of oil floating on water and iron sinking in water.

segments.title: Water Density Temperature Relationship
segments.summary: Describes how water's density changes with temperature, reaching maximum density at 4°C. Explains the unusual behavior of water density below 4°C.

segments.title: Earth's Core Density Formation
segments.summary: Explains how Earth's structure formed based on density differences, with heavier metals sinking to form the core while lighter silicates floated to form the crust.
